channel.title: Weird speaker sound.
channel.description:
[COLOR='Green'][b]Problem Solved[/b]
Today I decided to plug in my good ol'PS2 a old pair of speakers (Energy 3.1e) that was next to my TV but were unused. So I plug them into my Denon 545R (also old stuff but still in wonderful condition), but the sound is really weird. It's "scratched" if you know what I mean. As if the sound was at a really poor quality. But they shouldn't sound bad since they are still in good condition (atleast they look so).
Anyone got an idea? My Denon doesn't like my speakers? Wrong plugging (I'll post pics of the setup tomorrow)? HALP!
[i]Edit: Also when I use my Denon as a radio receiver, my speakers sound perfect [/i]
[COLOR='green'][i]Edit 2: What is this I don't even. After 5 hours of searching, it turns out I had to plug them into the Video holes instead of Phono. Now they sound crystal clear.[/i]

item.title: Weird speaker sound.
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
[COLOR=‘Green’]Problem Solved

Today I decided to plug in my good ol’PS2 a old pair of speakers (Energy 3.1e) that was next to my TV but were unused. So I plug them into my Denon 545R (also old stuff but still in wonderful condition), but the sound is really weird. It’s “scratched” if you know what I mean. As if the sound was at a really poor quality. But they shouldn’t sound bad since they are still in good condition (atleast they look so).

Anyone got an idea? My Denon doesn’t like my speakers? Wrong plugging (I’ll post pics of the setup tomorrow)? HALP!

Edit: Also when I use my Denon as a radio receiver, my speakers sound perfect

[COLOR=‘green’]Edit 2: What is this I don’t even. After 5 hours of searching, it turns out I had to plug them into the Video holes instead of Phono. Now they sound crystal clear.

Read full topic
